headline.print_headline: NFL: Vikings defender Nealy banned four games for doping

docs.snippet: Soccer’s world governing body is apparently indifferent to player safety, especially when it comes to head injuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: Soccer’s world governing body is apparently indifferent to player safety, especially when it comes to head injuries.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column faults soccer's governing body FIFA for failing to enforce medical protocols regarding head injuries during 2014 World Cup matches; notes that returning to action too quickly after sustaining a concussion could be fatal.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Injuries to Mascherano and Neymar Demonstrate Poor Medical Care
headline.main: Shouting About Diving, but Shrugging About Concussions
headline.print_headline: Shouting About Diving, but Shrugging About Concussions

docs.snippet: German Chancellor Angela Merkel met briefly with Russian President Vladimir Putin ahead of the football World Cup final in Brazil on Sunday.    Merkel was in Rio de Janeiro to see Germany play Argentina in the final, and Putin was attending becaus...
docs.lead_paragraph: German Chancellor Angela Merkel met briefly with Russian President Vladimir Putin ahead of the football World Cup final in Brazil on Sunday.    Merkel was in Rio de Janeiro to see Germany play Argentina in the final, and Putin was attending because Russia will host the next World Cup in 2018. The two leaders have been in regular telephone contact over the Ukraine crisis, with Merkel urging Putin to use his influence over separatists in eastern Ukraine to help bring about an end to fighting.

headline.main: Merkel and Putin Meet Before World Cup Final
headline.print_headline: Merkel and Putin Meet Before World Cup Final

docs.snippet: A freshman said she was sexually assaulted at Hobart and William Smith Colleges. The school’s handling of the investigation left her wishing she had remained silent....
docs.lead_paragraph: A freshman said she was sexually assaulted at Hobart and William Smith Colleges. The school’s handling of the investigation left her wishing she had remained silent.
docs.abstract: New York Times examination of rape case at Hobart and William Smith Colleges offers rare look inside one school's adjudication of rape complaints amid roiling national debate over how best to stop sexual assaults on campuses; internal records depict a school ill prepared to evaluate such serious allegations; case shows that school disciplinary panels operate in secret with scant accountability and limited protections for accuser or accused.

headline.seo: How One College Handled a Sexual Assault Complaint
headline.main: Reporting Rape, and Wishing She Hadn’t
headline.print_headline: Reporting Rape, and Wishing She Hadn’t

docs.snippet: Hundreds of millions of football fans watched Sunday's World Cup final by simply getting comfortable in front of their TV sets. In the Gaza Strip, under Israeli bombardment for six days, fans needed ingenuity and courage to witness Germany's 1-0 w...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of millions of football fans watched Sunday's World Cup final by simply getting comfortable in front of their TV sets. In the Gaza Strip, under Israeli bombardment for six days, fans needed ingenuity and courage to witness Germany's 1-0 win over Argentina.

headline.main: Gazans Need Ingenuity, Courage to Watch World Cup
headline.print_headline: Gazans Need Ingenuity, Courage to Watch World Cup

docs.snippet: Thousands of Argentine football fans gathered on the golden sands of Copacabana beach gasped and then fell into silence when Germany scored a stunning extra-time goal to claim the World Cup title on Sunday....

headline.main: Dejected Argentine Fans, Elated Germans in Brazil
